alert.note: Alert for Central Gunnison and Uncompahgre River Basin; Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River; Uncompahgre Plateau, Dallas Divide (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 01 at 2:08PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Ouray and central Montrose Counties through 245 PM MDT... At 207 PM MDT, a strong thunderstorm was 12 miles northeast of Norwood, or 20 miles southwest of Montrose, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Satellite indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Montrose. This includes the following highways... U.S. Highway 550 in Colorado near mile marker 130. U.S. Highway 50 in Colorado between mile markers 87 and 92. Colorado 90 between mile markers 82 and 89. Colorado 145 near mile marker 105. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Central Gunnison and Uncompahgre River Basin; Paradox Valley, Lower Dolores River; Uncompahgre Plateau, Dallas Divide
